intro: Aeollanthus elsholtzioides, commonly known as the narrow-leafed sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of southern Africa. It is a low-growing perennial shrub that thrives in sandy and gravelly soils, often found in coastal and inland dunes. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in dense clusters, which attract various pollinators. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in fine hairs to reduce water loss. Aeollanthus elsholtzioides is adapted to harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
